org.javact.lang
Class QuasiBehavior

java.lang.Object
  org.javact.lang.QuasiBehavior
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public abstract class QuasiBehavior
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Actors' primary behavior, with the standard available methods. Extended by automatically-generated abstract users' base-level classes defining become(). Can be directly implemented by users' base-level classes (using becomeAny() only).

Version:
0.5.0
See Also:
Serialized Form

          Creates a new QuasiBehavior.

                             BecomeCtI bec,
                             CreateCtI crt,
                             LifeCycleCtI lif,
                             MoveCtI mve,
                             SendCtI snd)
Actor creation ability (from a specific location and a set of components)

Parameters:
p - the place for hosting the actor
b - the initial behavior
box - the MailBox Component
bec - the Become Component
crt - the Create Component
lif - the Life Cycle Component
mve - the Move Component
snd - the Send Component
Returns:
the created actor

send

protected final void send(Message m,
                          Agent a)
Message sending ability

Parameters:
m - the message
a - the target actor

send

protected final void send(MessageWithReply mwr,
                          Agent a)
Message sending ability, with a requested reply This method is mandatory because java resolves overloading methods with a static computation of the argument, otherwise we won't get to the right send() method.

Parameters:
mwr - the message
a - the target actor

suicide

protected final void suicide()
Actor suicide ability. The actor suicides after the current message has been processed

go

protected final void go(java.lang.String p)
Actor's proactive mobility. Next message is processed on the new place.

Parameters:
p - the next place

go

protected final void go(java.lang.String p,
                        HookInterface h)
To set the next place of the actor (for the next message). Warning ! This methods never fails, the code beyond it will ever be executed. The mobility is done when the execution of the behavior is terminated, and the hook is called at this moment if an error occurs

Parameters:
p - the place where the actor will go
h - method resume() of the hook is called if if the mobility process fails

ego

protected final Agent ego()
Get the reference of the owner actor

Returns:
the reference of the owner actor

myPlace

protected final java.lang.String myPlace()
Get the place whereon the owner actor is located. The port is included since v4.1

Returns:
the place (an URL as a String)
